casebody.data:
HAARHUIS
v.
CHEEK 332P17-2 Supreme Court of North Carolina. May 9, 2019 Stephanie W. Anderson, Attorney at Law, Walter K. Burton, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, Cam Bordman, Attorney at Law, Charles M. Ivey, III, Attorney at Law, Charles M. Ivey, IV, Attorney at Law, Darren A. McDonough, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, for Cheek, Emily. J. David Stradley, Attorney at Law, Robert P. Holmes, IV, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Leto Copeley, Attorney at Law, Durham, for Haarhuis, Joris (Administrator), et al. Meghan Wray Deutsch-Blanco, Attorney at Law. Cynthia L. Van Horne, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Burton, Sue & Anderson, LLP. John P. Barringer, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Jeffrey B. Kuykendal, Attorney at Law, for Universal Insurance Company. Maynard M. Brown, Attorney at Law, Wilmington, Stephen C. Baynard, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Association of Defense Attorneys. Edward C. Boltz, Attorney at Law, Durham, for National Consumer Bankruptcy Rights Center, et al. The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 17th of December 2018 by National Consumer Bankruptcy Rights Center and National Association of Consumer Bankruptcy for leave to file Curiae Brief: "Motion Dismissed as moot by order of the Court in conference, this the 9th of May 2019." Davis, J. recused
